info.title: Video Computer Analyzer
info.description: Upload a short video (≤60 s) containing desktop or laptop computers. Receive a structured hardware analysis and an evaluation report that covers whether the machines meet your stated needs and estimates upgrade / future-proofing costs.

servers.description: Replace with your deployed server URL

get.description: Returns a simple status indicating the server is running.

post.summary: Analyze a video for computer hardware
post.description: Upload a video file (mp4, mov, avi, mkv – maximum 60 seconds). The server extracts frames, identifies every computer visible in the video, reads or infers hardware specs, and returns a full evaluation report including whether each machine meets the user's stated needs and estimated upgrade costs.

file.description: The video file to analyse (mp4, mov, avi, mkv). Must be 60 seconds or shorter.

user_needs.description: Describe the intended workload so the report can assess suitability. Example: 'I need to run 4K video editing, multiple virtual machines, and occasional machine-learning training.'

frame_count.description: Number of frames that were analysed.

visible_specs.description: Hardware specs readable from the video frames.

report.description: Full plain-text evaluation report with upgrade recommendations and cost estimates.

400.description: Bad request – e.g. video exceeds 60 seconds or cannot be read.
